intro: Justicia congestiflora var. humilior, commonly known as the dwarf flame flower, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It features showy, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in dense clusters during the summer months. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is prized for its vibrant floral display and is often used in rock gardens or as a container plant.
